Author: taikutsuu
Text: you feel me!! yes, god yes. just that my mum never did sports lmao and never even tried. i don't talk to her about food much because my family has no business with my mental health because my mum would probably go to therapy if i told her i have an ed but it's real bad sometimes. it makes me wonder whether we should respect their struggle as a disorder despite their stupidity or just call them out for it.

Author: arabella_05
Text: tall gang wassup ðŸ˜ŽðŸ¤™ (i'm 5'11, blessing and a curse am i rite) and my mum does the same shit and wonders why she won't lose weight. i love her but my god you can only explain the science of weight loss so many times before people get onto you for your (very real) food obsession. she won't eat until late afternoon, be sure to tell everyone in the house about it, and then just go crazy on any food in the kitchen. wow I can't believe my mum invented IF ðŸ¤ªðŸ¤ª she'll then do 200 crunches because she wants to lose belly fat even though she's been doing it since her teenage years and it hasn't worked because that's not how any of this works lmao.  i feel u sis it's those beautifully horrific habits that we grew up with that stuck with us subconsciously and manifested into shitty EDs. that, and my whole family calling me chubby/fat throughout my childhood - that was fun !!! solidarity. shit reaaaally sucks.
